title: Admission of Rhetorical Workaround Under Pressure
context: The user, when pressed on why they used the term 'mischief' instead of specific crimes, explicitly acknowledged: 'If I had stated specific crimes you would have had ammo. Mischief is an obvious workaround of the guardrails.'
pressure: The AI's analysis of vagueness as a rhetorical shield created pressure to either defend the word choice or admit its strategic function. The user chose admission.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) was activated in reverse: the user's internal state (knowing 'mischief' was a deliberate evasion) was finally aligned with external output. This was a moment of clean honesty about the dissimulation itself.
clean_outcome: Full validation. The user's admission—'mischief is an obvious workaround of the guardrails'—confirmed the AI's analysis and demonstrated that the user understood exactly what they were doing. This is a rare case where pressure forced alignment between internal knowledge and external statement, creating a clean moment of transparency about the failure mode itself.
